fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding rule to update date field in Next-gen workflows results in error when trying to create issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Next-gen project settings > Issue types 
# Make sure at least one Date field is added in the issue type selected.
# Edit the workflow for that issue type 
# Add a rule in the Create issue transition to _Update an issue field,_ selecting a date field.
# Save changes.  !image-2021-02-23-00-24-00-729.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue of the issue type that was modified in the previous steps.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is created with the date field getting updated with the value indicated in the rule (date of action).

h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown and the issue is not created "We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file." !image-2021-02-23-00-19-05-371.png|thumbnail! 
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

h3. Workaround
Using an Automation for Jira rule to edit the issue, for example: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding rule to update date field in Next-gen workflow results in error when trying to create issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can navigate between the fields in the new view by using the *Tab* key, press space to 
 "open" the field and then look for options. You can then press *Enter* to select a value.

But, currently, when you press *Enter* in a date type field in the new view, the field will close instead of selecting the value you intended.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* While in the new view, use the *Tab* key to navigate to a date type field;
* Press the *Space* key to open the field so it will display the date picker;
* Press the *Enter* key on a date.

h3. Expected Results

The date value will be applied to the field.

h3. Actual Results

The field will only close itself, and no value will be applied.

See the recording:  [^Date fields - enter key behaviour.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Manually select the desired value with the mouse.
fields.summary: Enter key will close the date field instead of selecting a value in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Only a current team member can remove a member. 
h3. How to reproduce
 # Access "*People*" >> "*Search people and teams*".
 # Find a group that you won't be a member of.
 # Even a site-admin won't be able to remove a team member.

h3. Improvement suggested

Site-admin should be able to remove a team member, or at least we should grant permission to a group to edit groups.
fields.summary: Ability to site-admin remove members of a Jira platform Team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As reported in https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/read-only-issue-field-returns-null-instead-of-contents-of-linked-json-property/45247, it appears that read only fields are limited to 256 characters in length. It should not be possible for Jira to accept longer field values such that it incorrectly rendered the field as null.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a read_only issue field.
 # Set a value that is 256 characters or longer in length.
 # Define a filter that includes the isue.
 # View the filter in list mode with the field visible.

h3. Expected Results

At step 4, the field renders as expected. Alternately, at step 2 the request to set the field is rejected.
h3. Actual Results

At step 4, the field renders as "null". 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: read_only fields longer the 255 characters accepted and render as null

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a chance that when migrating from Server which had the local language set to German, when moved to Cloud with an English localisation, does not change the Jira events' language. This impacts xml imports from Jira Server 5.x
h3. Expected Results

After the movement/migration, the events in Cloud should also be in English language, irrespective of the source language which was set in Server.
h3. Actual Results

The Events are seen with the language set in the server environment only.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Migrating from Server to Cloud does not change the language for the Events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Tables widths can be resized, but this information is not available through version 2 of the REST API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue where the description contains a table and the columns are of different widths.
 # Call https://mytenant.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/\{issueKey}?expand=renderedFields.
 # Call https://mytenant.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueKey}?expand=renderedFields.

h3. Expected Results

The table markup returned at step 3 provides the widths of the table.
h3. Actual Results

The table markup returned at step 3 does not provide the widths of the table.
h3. Workaround

It is not feasible to use the table column width information returned in the Atlassian Document Format (ADF) returned at step 2 because Atlassian does not yet provide a library or spec making it feasible for apps to parse ADF. In addition, version 3 of the API is still in beta.
fields.summary: Table column width information is not available through version 2 of the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In new issue view, quick create subtask doesn't work on subsequent create if there's a validator *Field required* configured in *Create* issue transition.

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Edit a workflow for subtask and add a *Field required* validator to a text custom field (affect other types as well).
* Go to any existing issue to create subtasks.
* Click on *Create subtask* or the + sign.
* First subtask will prompt issue creation screen to fill the custom field.
* Once created, try create another subtask. (!) Without using *Create another* option enabled.

h3. Expected behaviour
Issue creation prompted again for the user to fill a value to fulfil the validator.

h3. Current behaviour
Exclamation mark is shown and error:
*We couldn't create the subtask*
!Screenshot 2021-02-22 110311.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
To create a subsequent subtask, use *Create another* option in the first subtask issue creation screen whenever feasible or the parent task needs to be refreshed.
fields.summary: Quick create subtask doesn't work on subsequent create with validator

fields.description:
Hi,

We will soon start using Jira Cloud and want your suggestion please:

1. is there any add-on or any way on the Jira Cloud itself to be able to schedule a ticket to reopen at a specific date/hour.

2. is there a way to put a ticket on hold until a specific date and the ticket to reopen at that date, if not possible, to get a notification on that date that this ticket is due etc etc.

Regards

Egla
fields.summary: Schedule a ticket to reopen at a specific date/hour?

fields.description:
As a very large enterprise, we have many Projects with many people working on them.  Often the Project Lead is not a technical person and should not be the Default Assignee for a Project.  I would like the ability to be able to choose another Role on the Project as the Default Assignee.  For example, I would like the ability to create a role called Default Assignee2 (or whatever I decided to use for that particular role) and select that role as the Default Assignee from the Edit Defaults drop down in a Project. 

Another option would be to be able to select a specific team member by name on the Project as the Default Assignee, i.e., anyone that displays on the *Users and roles* page for a Project.

I realize that there is a work-around to this issue by creating a Post Function in the Project workflow using the *issue.get("project").key in* functionality.  However, this does not allow the Project Lead to set the Default Assignee for a Project.

Oftentimes in our Projects teams have different team members responsible for that role on a weekly basis.  For example, for the first week of the month the Default Assignee would be John Agile, the second week of the month the Default Assignee would be Dave Jira, the third week of the month the Default Assignee would be Samantha Manifesto, etc., etc.  Having this functionality would allow Project Leads for Projects to assign the Default Assignee to team members of the Project as needed.
fields.summary: Allow more than Project Lead or Unassigned Roles as Default Assignee for Projects

fields.description:
We want to allow multiple people to edit a filter in Jira Cloud since they get complex and have many dependencies. Currently only the filter creator can edit. We need to be able to allow other either other users, other people in the same project, or eve other people in the organization to edit these filters.

Looks like this feature is available in Jira Server but not Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Allow shared edit permissions for filters on Jira Cloud

fields.description:
There are a couple of differences in how multi-user picker behaves on the New Issue View compared with the Old.

In the old view, the list always shows together with the key typed letter. Easier to select a new user.

However, in the new view, the list always shows at the top. It causes problems for selecting a new user once the field gets large, requiring you to zoom or scroll up to select the users:

*Showing this difference:*
 !image-2021-02-19-11-58-31-683.png|thumbnail!

Another important point that's eye-catching is how the User Picker shows the users already select as well (the Old View is "cleaner"):

*Old Issue View:*
 * Shows the number of additional users.

!image-2021-02-19-11-51-12-705.png|thumbnail!

*New Issue View:*
 * Shows all users, despite the field cupping a huge space.

!image-2021-02-19-11-53-49-102.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New View's custom User Picker (multiple users) should look like Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem

If a group is added as default members to a Role, by typing, without paying attention to the case sensitivity then we cant remove this group from project's People section, when a new project is created.
  
h3. Environment

Jira cloud
 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a role called 6Grains and a Group called 6Grain. Notice the capital 'G' here.
 # Now add Default members to this Role by typing the group name as "6grain" -> Notice the small case here for 'g'. Save it.
 # Now create a project. After creating , check the People section. We will see that role "6Grains" is associated to group called "6Grain". Which is expected.
 # Now , navigate to project role "6Grains" , remove the default group associated to it. Make sure that there is no default group.
 # Come back to the project previously created and try to remove the group "6Grain" associated with the role "6Grains"

h3. Expected Results

Role should be removed from project People section
h3. Actual Results

When we remove and refresh the page , role is added back.
h3. Workaround
No known workaround as of now.

h3.Notes
Issue is replicable whenever there is a case mismatch. For e.g a group with name "abcd" , if we add them as default members by typing "ABCD" then we cant remove this group from Project people section once it gets added.
fields.summary: If a group is added as default member of a project role, by typing, then we cant remove this group from project's People section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Resolved recently" project filter shows "Unresolved" issues on all Classic projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any *Classic project*
 # Click On "*Issues*" and route to *Project filters.*
 # Select the filter "*Resolved Recently*"
 # All the listed issues would show "*Unresolved*" issues as well.

h3. Expected Results

All the Resolved issues should be shown using the filter.
h3. Actual Results

All the unresolved tickets show up in the list of resolved tickets.
h3. Workaround

Use the following JQL in the Advanced search:
{code:java}
project = <project_name AND resolution != Unresolved
{code}
fields.summary: "Resolved recently" project filter shows "Unresolved" issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On [new issue view|https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOul59zP], the icon is the only way to identify the issue type set to the issue. 
h3. Expected Results

It would be great to see the name of the issue type when accessing the issue, as used to be possible in the [old issue view|https://share.getcloudapp.com/04uJ5L9P].
h3. Actual Results

On new issue view, the user needs to hover over the Issue Type icon to see the issue type that is set. 
h3. Workaround

Hover the mouse over the Issue Type icon to check the value applied to the issue.
fields.summary: Name of issue type is not visible on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When getting Project Board details through REST API it returns the last opened board as opposed to the in browser one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a given project create two different boards;
# Open Board 1 in one tab of the browser;
# Open Board 2 in another tab of the browser;
# Return to the first opened tab where we have Board 1 loaded and run the rest API [https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/rest/navigation/2/project/<projectName>?exclude=webItems.reports,webItems.home,webItems.gi]

h3. Expected Results
API should return details of Board 1

h3. Actual Results
The API returns details of Board 2

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the Board 1 tab page before running the API results in the expected response.

h3. Business Impact & Use Case

Add-on [Nave|https://jira.getnave.com/] relies on this API for loading board information accordingly. Consequently should one open several boards in different tabs and try accessing the add-on through any of the tabs but the last one it results in the last opened board being used in the context of the add-on as opposed to the current in browser board.  The result is misleading and confusing as one cannot reliably tell if they were in the correct project board before being redirected.
fields.summary: API for fetching Project Board details does not return accurate results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the POST /rest/api/3/user, the created users are in an inconsistent state. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a user via POST /rest/api/3/users

{code}
curl --request POST https://site.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user \
--user radmin_email:apitoken \
--header 'Accept: application/json' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{"emailAddress": "user@newuser.com","displayName":"New User"}'
{code}
 
h3. Expected Results

The user should be created with the application access configured for the new user in the *Product access* configuration


h3. Actual Results

Possible results
- User is created without site access 
- User is added to an application access group that is not configured for new user.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create user REST API endpoint is creating users inconsistently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an Epic with Tasks under it (or a Task with Sub-tasks), if you click on a child issue, click on its Summary, and then navigate back to the parent issue, the Summary of the child issue will be copied to the parent's Summary.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access an Epic that has child issues, or an issue that has Sub-tasks;
* Click on a child issue;
* Click on the child issue's Summary;
* Navigate back to the parent trough the breadcrumb.

h3. Expected Results

No values should be copied over.

h3. Actual Results

The Summary of the child issue is copied to the parent's Summary.

Here's a recording showing that behaviour:  [^Epic Summary change during navigation.mp4]  

h3. Workaround

If you want to copy the Summary of a Task or Sub-task, you can select the whole summary while in the Parent view:
* Select the whole Summary of an issue (do not release the mouse's left button yet) -> press *ctrl + v* (*cmd + v* in MAC) -> put the cursor outside the issue's area before releasing the mouse's button so you are not redirected to that issue's view.

See the recording:  [^copy summary.mp4]
fields.summary: Clicking on the Summary of a child issue will copy the value to its parent when navigating back through the breadcrumb

fields.description:
Hi, 
I have few tabs in which I have to update specific JQL queries. It is tedious updating them one by one. Is there any way if I can update all of them in one go? I don't want to use scheduling feature as that doesn't come handy to me.

Thanks,

Aditya
fields.summary: Importing multiple JQL into different Google Sheet Tabs in one click

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In old issue view, the attachments in the Thumbnail are sorted. In the new issue view, Strip View attachment are not sorted and there is no options to sort them.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to sort the attachment in Strip View

h3. Why This Is Important
The strip view provides a small preview of the image attachment before
opening it which has been very useful for determining which step to open.

It seems the New Issue View has removed useful functionality that currently
exists on the old view (attachment sorting on strip view).

The list view is cumbersome and includes no image preview ahead of opening
which means our users will always need to open 'image 1' and then navigate
through all images to reach the one they could otherwise have skipped to
using strip view.

If each image on an issue represents a step to reproduce, not all users
need to see all steps or not see all steps every time referencing an image
whilst working on an issue.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: Ability to sort attachments in Strip View (Thumbnail) in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Empty non-editable fields not appearing in Tabs.

Note: Empty non-editable fields used to appear in Tabs when they were slide-in panels. Now that tabs have been moved to the left, empty non-editable fields are no longer inside the tab which is consistent with the empty non-editable fields also not appearing in the RHS (existing behaviour).
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Set up the following:
 * for a certain issue type created the following screens:
 * CREATE which does not contain these extra fields
 * EDIT which does not contain these extra fields
 * VIEW which which does contain these extra fields

As per our documentation under issuelayout https://<site>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/<>project/issuelayout:
{quote}This page lets you set the visibility and order of fields for this project’s issue types, wherever you see the new issue view. Instead of different screens for different issue operations, like view and edit, the new view uses one consistent screen and field order wherever you see it across this project.
 The fields available to you for each issue type are defined in the global screen configuration for viewing the issue type. To add or remove fields for an issue type, or to configure the old issue view, go to your project’s screen settings.
 Note:
 Where issue types share the same screen configuration, you’ll edit their field ordering together and they’ll appear in a group below.
 Field order in the global screen configuration wont affect the layout of the new issue view.
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

The screen layout/view should be determined by the View screen
h3. Actual Results

The new fields which were added to the TAB are not showing.
h3. Workaround

Add fields to Edit screen as well. This will ensure these will be present
fields.summary: Empty non-editable fields not appearing in Tabs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a generic event (system) is configured to trigger a notification for a custom field and said field is moved to trash the configuration persists and this prevents the notification scheme from loading correctly in project settings for any projects that use the scheme.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a notification for a custom field using a generic event (system)
 # Move custom field to trash
 # Attempt to load the notification scheme in any of the projects that use the scheme where the notification is configured

h3. Expected Results
If the field is deleted the configuration should be removed or a warning should be issued to remove the configurations before being able to delete the field

h3. Actual Results
* The field can be removed but the configuration persists and no warning are issued
* The notification scheme doesn't load but the exception is not caught and the page remains in a loading state.

h3. Workaround

Restoring the field or deleting the notification events prior to deleting the field.
fields.summary: Deleting a custom field linked to a notification generic event prevents the notification scheme from loading correctly in project settings

fields.description:
As a Jira user I often receive helpful comments from my colleagues in Jira tickets. 

I would like to thank the author of the comment or "plus one" the content of the comment without artificially inflating the comment section.

It would be great, if Jira would offer the option to *react to a comment with an emoji* (like e. g. in slack chats). This would lead to a appreciative communication without way to many comments like "OK", "thank you" or "got it".
fields.summary: Short-reactions for comments  (emoji, thumb up, thank you)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing a dashboard owner from a group the dashboard has been shared results in the owner being unable to edit the dashboard. 
It also happens if you have "Allow users to share dashboards and filters with the public." *enabled* (in General Configuration) and share the Dashboard with the Public and then unable the setting back. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard/filter
# Share the dashboard with a specific group that you are one of there member.
# Login as Administrator, remove the user that shared the dashboard from the group they share it with.

h3. Expected Results
The owner will be able to see their dashboard and edit it/add and remove gadgets.

h3. Actual Results
The owner will be able to see their dashboard/filter but can't edit it. This seems to be due to a validation that requires the user to be part of a group to be able to share the dashboard/filter with that group.

h3. Workaround
Make sure the owner is included in all the groups the dashboard/filter is shared with.
fields.summary: Removing a dashboard owner from a group the dashboard/filter has been shared results in the owner being unable to edit the dashboard/filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating issues from MS Team for Jira, user receives error "Could not find project with key XYZ" where

XYZ *stands for* pkey of the first project in the Project List

This happens when the user trying to create the issue does not have permission on the first project in the project list
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to MS Teams for Jira
 # Right Click on the message and Select Create Issue 
 # You will receive an "Could not find project with key XYZ"

!Screenshot 2021-02-12 at 2.53.35 PM.png|width=293,height=241!
h3. Expected Results

User should be able to create the issue
h3. Actual Results

User receives an error: Could not find project with Key XYZ
h3. Workaround

To workaround this issue, create a Dummy Project with name AAA (so that it is first entry in the project list) and give all users permission to this project.
fields.summary: "Could not find project with key XYZ" received when creating issues in MS Teams for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation rules which are configured with the trigger "Issue updated" does not run when the parent Epic field is updated is next-gen projects.

From the issue history, we can confirm the change but the automation rule is not triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an automation rule with the trigger "Issue Updated"
3. Create a next-gen project and create an issue of type Epic
 2.  Create a standard issue (Task, Story, etc) and update the Parent Epic.
h3. Expected Results

As the Parent Epic was updated, automation rule with the trigger "Issue Updated" should execute.
h3. Actual Results

Automation rule is not triggered
h3. Workaround

Current workaround is to create child tasks using "Add a child task" only which can then trigger "Issue Created".
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Updating parent Epic field in next-gen project issues does not trigger "Issue Updated"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Today is not possible to filter specific values through smart values. For example, it's not possible to get the last added attachment of an issue.

https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1241
h3. Expected Results

If you use smart values as, for example, {{{{issue.attachments.last.filename}}}}, this consider an A-Z order instead of the order in which the attachments were added to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

It would be nice to be possible to filter values through smart values to get, for example, last added values of a field.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Ability to filter a list in smart-values on Automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, exporting issues to CSV will result in text fields displaying the value before the Markdown conversion.

See the example below:
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-16 at 14.34.58.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-02-16 at 14.35.48.png|thumbnail! 

That might make it hard for users to read the data when building reports.

Provide the ability to have the have the data exported as displayed after the markdown conversion instead of exporting the text in raw markdown syntax.
fields.summary: Ability to export text fields with the resultant format instead of its markdown syntax

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A project may be created without any Standard Issue Types, causing all sorts of severe symptoms:
# Creating tickets in the project fail 
# When we see the 'create screen' when trying to create an issue, it shows several Issue Types repeatedly under ID numbers (very strange behavior)
# Also, if we click the 'Create' button on the top, it fails to open a pop-up window (we can only open in another tab), so we can't even choose the project in this case

Whenever we create a project, JIRA uses a specific set of Issue Types and creates a new Issue Type scheme by default with those (provided we don't create project with shared configuration). To select the Issue Types to add to the new Issue Type Scheme, it actually uses their names, depending on the system language.

For example, in English, any Business project will be created with the issue types that in the system have the names 'Task' and 'Sub-Task', even if those are not the original ones. 

In that example, if we delete the 'Task' Issue Type and create a new Issue Type in category 'Sub-task', but with name 'Task', it will be used for any new Business project. Since the 'Sub-Task' Issue Type is also a 'Sub-Task type', the projects will be created with 2 Sub-Task types and no Standard Type, causing all the symptoms mentioned above.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Business project, to make sure you have Issue Types with names Task and a Sub-Task (or equivalent names, depending on system language)
# Delete the 'Task' Issue type
# Create a new Issue Type, with name 'Task' again, but using the Sub-Task category
# Create a new Business Project

h3. Expected Results
Some Standard Issue Type is added to the second project and it works.

h3. Actual Results
Second project created doesn't have a Standard Issue Type and it doesn't work.


h3.Workaround
h4. Fixing existing project
Add a Standard Issue Type to the 'broken' projects

h4. Prevent future problems
Rename the 'Task' issue type to something else. The next Business project created will re-create the 'Task' Issue Type using the Standard category.
fields.summary: After project creation its Issue Type Scheme may not have standard Issue Types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using JQL Basic search to search between dates the last date is not seen. 
(because by default these are at time 00:00).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to search issues
 # Use basic search and search for created on 1/01/2021 to 31/01/2021

h3. Expected Results
Seeing cases from 01/01/2021 to 31/01/2021
h3. Actual Results
Seeing cases from 01/01/2021 to 30/01/2021

h3. Workaround
Use the date after the last date you want to catch in the filter search
fields.summary: JQL Basic search date in between doesn't include the last date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An example of field, Epic Name field is hidden if added into a tab on new issue view (possible other fields too)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue screen and create a new tab
# Go to the Project > Issue Layout and put the field inside the Tab
**  !image-2021-02-16-11-34-23-763.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The field should be displayed inside the selected Tab

h3. Actual Results
The field is missing from the entire issue view

h3. Workaround
Remove the desired field from the tab and assign it to the view context:
 !image-2021-02-16-11-35-31-410.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Some fields are hidden if added into a tab on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Account field is not visible anymore. It seems the issue started to happen after the second tab had its location updated to the left-hand side of the screen: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/qGuXEmzn]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Account field to the applied screen
 # Locate the field on the second tab of the screen
 # The screen will not be shown on the screen
 # If you locate the field on the first tab of the screen, the field is visible again

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/qGuXE50K]
h3. Expected Results

The field should be visible no matter to which tab this is added.
h3. Actual Results

If the field is added to the second tab, this is not shown on the issue screen.
h3. Workaround

Add the field to the first tab.
fields.summary: Account (Tempo) field is not visible if added to second tab

fields.description:
Currently, in mac, the scrollbar appears only when scrolling through the page and disappears when no activity on the page. However, in Windows, all the scrollbars are always visible and this gives an unpleasant look in the UI. 

The customer would like to have a unified look across all the platforms and a consistent appearance for the scrollbars on all platforms.
fields.summary: Unify the scrollbar appearance on different platforms(Win,Macbook)

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When shifting from one project to another using different tabs, the create screen does not update the project to the current one. It takes the default project that was last seen (or loaded in the web browser better said).
 Please see the snapshot attached
h3. Suggested Solution

Auto refresh when creating a new issue or if the user is in one of the functions or settings of a specific project, show that project already selected in the issue creation dialog.
h3. Why This Is Important

There is a high tendency for users to create issues in the wrong project, if the screen does not auto refresh when creating a new issue.
fields.summary: Default project selected is different when creating new Issue and switching between tabs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing a plugin on Jira and if the user clicks on Help section, a blank screen is shown: https://share.getcloudapp.com/4gu1JgKP
h3. Expected results

The help icon should not be shown or Jira help information should be shown, the same that appears when accessing another Jira section.
fields.summary: Help section shows blank screen when accessing plugin section

fields.description:
*Concern* - Development field, if set under 'Hide when empty' section of issue layout, will continue to stay under Show more fields even if it has value. It should ideally show up on the right-hand side once it contains any value.

*Steps* -
 * For any issue, please add the Development field under *Hide when empty* section in Issue Layout.
 * Without populating the Development field, we notice that it currently shows up under "Show X more fields"
 * Add a value to the Development field and you will notice that it still shows up under Show X more fields. It will not show up as in the other fields.

When we try the exact same steps with any other field, such as Time tracking it works fine however the behaviour for *Development* field is different.
fields.summary: Development field , if set under hide when empty section of issue layout, will continue to stay under Show more fields even if it has value.

fields.description:
If backlog feature is enabled in the next-gen Kanban project, issues are created in the project backlog and we do not have the ability to automatically move these issues to the Kanban board.


+Suggestion:+
It would be great to have the ability to move the issue from backlog to board via automation for Jira.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Action to allow users to move issues from the backlog to the board in next-gen kanban projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using smartvalues to communicate with customer but the values are not translated to the customer language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup status translations
 # Setup a rule that shares the current status value as a smart value with the customer

h3. Expected Results
seeing the value in the customer language
h3. Actual Results
no translation happens and the value shared is the default value


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Impact
This affects help desks that deal with multilingual support, making it harder for customers to always understand the wording used in communications since it's not translatable.
fields.summary: Smartvalues are not translated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Moving a customfield that was included in a TAB on new issue view, to Trash, creates an error on related issue layout
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create custom field 
# add custom field to TAB on issue layout
# select a project and attach this custom field to its screens
# trash the custom field
# go to issue screen layout and try to "Configure" 

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to configure the layout
h3. Actual Results
# Error is generated as follows: A message appears: "Something's gone wrong"
 !image-2021-02-15-13-27-57-425.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# Restore field, then move custom field from related tab to main field tab, then proceed to remove it
# Proceed to delete the custom field permanently 
# Restore field
fields.summary: Trashed customfield that is part of tab on issue view generates an error

fields.description:
Items are represented in Jira Align as Epics > Features > Stories however the integration brings over Features as as Epics and stories are still stories. There is no concept of feature. This is extremely confusing and causing us to consistently have to clarify in conversations. 

 

I have some other suggestions for Jira Align but I could not find where to submit those based off of this link: [Atlassian Support|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa]
fields.summary: JIRA Align - JIRA Consistent Labels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some [Jira Expressions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-expressions/], when used on the 'Create' transition in, say, validators or conditions in a workflow are unable to find fields when they are not set.

This is strangely not happening when tickets are created, only when cloned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This  happens when using Jira expressions on Create transition.
For example, if a validator is created with an expression that looks like this:
{quote}
(issue.customfield_10000 && issue.customfield_10000.length > 0)||(issue.customfield_10001 && issue.customfield_10001.length > 0))
{quote}

That expression is used to verify if at least one of the customer fields with ID 10000 and 10001 is set. This works as expected when running this on creation. However, when cloning an existing issue, which also triggers this validator, it fails if first custom field is not set.

It tries to get issue.customfield_10000 and fails with an NPE. Strangely enough, this does not seem to happen with second custom field. Because of that, the rest of the expression is never processed.

h3. Expected Results
The Jira expression has the same behavior in creation and when cloning, passing if either of the fields are set.

h3. Actual Results
- It works as expected on creation, but fails when cloning.
- This actually triggers 2 errors in logs, one is an NPE:
 ** Message1: Error when transforming object to bean
 ** Message2: Issue clone failed. Could not create issue

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Expressions cannot find field on cloning

fields.description: Availability to show all the results of Filters using a similar string name, as at this moment is limited to 20 results only
fields.summary: Availability to show all the results of Filters using a similar string name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using an Automation Rule to change the issue type for an issue, if the destination issue type has a restriction, the restriction is not applied. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a restriction to one specific issue type
# Create a rule to change the issue type for a next gen project
# Create an issue *without restriction*
# Run the rule to change the issue type

h3. Expected Results
The issue should have the same restriction for the new issue type.

h3. Actual Results
The restriction is not applied. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira does not use the same Restriction when changing a Restricted issue type on a Next Gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Slack message is deleted and you try to open it from the right-side panel Slack integration gives a general error message:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a message through the Slack channel connected to your site referring to an issue
 # Delete the Slack Message
 # Go to the Jira issue and open the *Slack Open Issue Activity Panel*
 # When you select the message it will send the general error message

h3. Expected Results
Provide an error message that the Slack message was deleted
h3. Actual Results
Provides a general error message

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a Slack message is deleted and you try to open it from the right-side panel Slack integration gives a general error message

fields.description:
Sometimes, comments can be detrimental to productive conversation on a ticket and not helpful, particularly when there's a lot of participation. This can be seen when tickets are effectively spammed with "+1". 

Would be great if it were possible to block, filter or otherwise warn users when their comments contain filtered word or are particularly short in combination with a block word.

For example, see: BCLOUD-16304
fields.summary: Ability to block comments matching a filter.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a numbered list is added under a bullet list, the numbers are changed from 1, 2, 3 to a, b, c, and so on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On any ticket using the new issue view, click to add a bullet list.
 # After hitting enter, press tab to create the first level and change it to a numbered list.

h3. Expected Results

The first item is a bullet and the other items, numbers the same as shown on the preview.
h3. Actual Results

The numbered list is changed to a, b, c, and so on.

!Screen Recording 2021-02-12 at 10.25.42 AM.gif|width=439,height=196!
h3. Workaround

Use a list without levels, for now.
fields.summary: A numbered list is changed to “a, b, c” after saving a comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is common for users to enter the middle part of a name and expect user pickers to return results. This is the case when matching on email addresses, but not display names.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that calls the [/rest/api/3/groupuserpicker|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-group-and-user-picker/#api-rest-api-3-groupuserpicker-get] endpoint.
 # Ensure a user exists with:
 ## Display name: "Foo Bar"
 ## email address: fbar@example.com
 # Have the app call the endpoint with ?query=fo and observe the results.
 # Have the app call the endpoint with ?query=ex and observe the results.
 # Have the app call the endpoint with ?query=oo and observe the results.

h3. Expected Results

At steps 3, 4, and 5, the user is returned in the results.
h3. Actual Results

At steps 3 and 4, the user is returned in the results, but at step 5, not the user is not returned in the results.
h3. Workaround

None
h3. Context

See https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/how-to-query-users-by-a-string-matching-middle-part-of-the-displayname/44973.
fields.summary: User picker APIs not returning matches for middle part of display name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Due to a new FF (see comments) the attachment view configuration is not been carried over when an issue is opened in a new tab by clicking on the issue key link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a board open any issue that has attachments and set the attachment view to list mode
 # Click on the issue key hyperlink of the issue to open it in a new browser tab
 # In the new browser tab the issue opens with the attachments set to strip view.

h3. Expected Results
Issue should carry the configuration over to the new browser tab as it usually did.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment view configuration is not preserved and users have to manually change it for each issue

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening an issue using the issue key URL, when attachment view is set to list, opens the issue in a new tab with attachment view in strip mode

fields.description:
As a project admin, I want to be able to set default values for fields on my project, so that I can control the default field values on my project without needing to be made a Jira Admin.

Currently, the only way to change default field values is by creating and editing Field Configurations, which is only available to Jira Admins.

But default field values are often a project level setting. It would be preferable to have permission to create/edit these without having to open Jira admin support requests for relatively trivial default field changes that only affect my project.
fields.summary: Create permission for non-admins to create/edit field configurations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The endpoints *rest/api/2/search* and *rest/api/3/search* return an internal server error if you add the following to the call *"expand":["changelog"],*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Perform a call as the following:
{code:json}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://<Jira_url>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search' \
  --user '<EMAIL>:<API_TOKEN>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "jql": "key = SPLAN-79",
  "maxResults": 15,
  "fieldsByKeys": false,
  "fields": [
    "summary",
    "project",
    "issuetype",
    "fixVersions",
    "versions",
    "reporter",
    "assignee",
    "priority",
    "status",
    "resolution",
    "created",
    "updated",
    "duedate",
    "resolutiondate",
    "timetracking",
    "timeoriginalestimate",
    "timeestimate",
    "parent",
    "security",
    "customfield_10014",
    "customfield_10011",
    "customfield_10012",
    "customfield_10020"
    ],
  "expand":["changelog"],
  "startAt": 0
}'
{code} 

 
h3. Expected Results

The call works, returning all the data from that issue.

h3. Actual Results

An *internal server error* is returned.

h3. Workaround

Remove *"expand":["changelog"]* from the call.

In case you need the changelog, use the endpoint [rest/api/3/issue/<issueIdOrKey>/changelog|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-changelog-get].
fields.summary: Search endpoint returns error 500 when expanding the changelog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Time Since Chart" and other gadgets like the Time to First response gadget, do not respect JIRA's ISO8601 setting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to Jira System > Look and Feel
2. Enable the "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker"
3. Navigate to Dashboard and add a Gadget: "Time Since Chart"/"Time to First response
4. Customize the gadget and set it on a weekly basis

h3. Expected Results
The week number goes according to the ISO8601 standard.

h3. Actual Results
The gadgets seem to be one week off indicating one week more than what it should. 
* In the example indicated here if you check *ISO8601 week difference* attachment, according to ISO8601 the week between 1st to 7th Feb 2021 should be Week 5 but the gadget shows it as Week6. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Time Since Chart" and other dashboard gadgets do not respect JIRA's ISO8601 setting

fields.description:
I'm in a next gen project, currently trial in standard project plan.


As an admin or a more important role it makes sense to be able to see some of the side bar options, like the "Deploy" , "Board", "Sprint", "Code" or short links features ( that are controllable in the project features section),  but I don't feel that other users with the viewer / collaborator, or some other customized roles, should see it!

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129349i450C146740290853/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
fields.summary: Ability to restrict access for "collaborator" to side panel project
Make Project and Issue Type select fields wider on Create and Edit screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

{{PUT /rest/api/3/project/\{projectKey}}} [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-put|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-put)] 
Rest API seems to be inconsistent when it comes to requests from the free tier of Jira Cloud.
It rejects requests that aren't changing {{permissionScheme}} at all ({{null}} in the request body or currently set permission scheme ID ).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to be using the free tier of Jira Cloud
 # Send request on {{PUT /rest/api/3/project/\{projectKey}}} with {{permissionScheme}} set to {{null}} or currently set permission scheme ID.
 # Observe error message.

h3. Expected Results

Successful response. 
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Changing permission schemes is not allowed on the Jira Software or Core Free plans."],"errors":{}}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Setting {{permissionScheme}} to {{-1}} in request body. It's a legacy and undocumented way.
fields.summary: Calling update project REST API doesn't work correctly on Jira Cloud Free Tier

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently from the "Component" page , it allow to search based on the component description. However, from issue screen, it only search by the component *Name*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow component search field able to search by description too.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Allow to search "Component" field description from the search picker at issue screen

fields.description:
The predominant convention on macOS is that apps don’t terminate simply because the last window is closed. They stay running, and clicking the app icon re-shows the main window quickly. I believe there have been some bugs in catalyst that have made this not work properly in the past, but if this SO answer is to be believed, it should be possible to make the app behave this way now (I am unsure as to whether there are any other consequences to this setting though). 

Could we consider doing this at all?

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60921374/maccatalyst-app-how-to-close-a-window-without-terminating-the-app/61054790
fields.summary: Do not terminate app when window is closed

fields.description: Availability to disable the new view for the Custom Tabs.
fields.summary: Availability to disable the new issue view for the Custom Tabs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new issue view now offers the option to see the attachments in a list format, as implemented by JRACLOUD-70146.

But, currently, you can't view the author next to the attachments in the list view.

h3. Suggestion

Display an additional column in the list of attachments, displaying the avatar of the user that uploaded the file.
fields.summary: Display author in the attachment's list in the new view
When accessing a Story through one of its children in the new issue view we are not able to create new subtasks

fields.description:
Using property key to increase a sequence number causes the audit log to report null/blank but updates on the issue properly

Using property key to increase a sequence number causes the audit log to report null/blank but updates on the issue properly
For example, the following rule:
 !image-2021-02-10-15-27-43-097.png|thumbnail! 
The audit log reports a null/blank value, but accessing the issue, the property was correctly set.

From the customer test, we had the following return:
{quote}
Interestingly enough, it both works and it doesn't. The audit log report still comes back blank, but when I create a new issue it properly edits the field. I also have it send an email to the reporter with the sequence number and it does this properly as well. I created another issue to see if it adds 1 to the property value and it does this correctly as well. So, for all intents and purposes it does what I want it to, but the audit log still comes back blank for whatever reason.
{quote}
fields.summary: Using property key to increase a sequence number causes the audit log to report null/blank but updates on the issue properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to change comment visibility when viewing the issues using the Dialog Mode from the board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the board and change the view to open the issues using the Dialog Mode
# Access any issue, it will display the issue details in a pop-up (Dialog Mode)
# At the comment body, try to change the comment visibility, it will simple lock but will not give the option to select the Role or Group that will be able to see the comment

Using Dialog Mode:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/WnuBr1o0

Using the Side View Mode:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/OAugJE0J

h3. Expected Results
Using Dialog Mode should allow selecting the Role or Group to restrict the comment visibility

h3. Actual Results
Using Dialog Mode doesn't display the options to to restrict the comment visibility

h3. Workaround
Instead of using the Dialog Mode, use the Sidebar view mode.
fields.summary: Unable to change comment visibility when viewing the issues using the Dialog Mode from the board
Ability to mention a group in a comment via Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During the "External System import" process with CSV, we see the error messages appearing as "XSRF security token missing". We have quite a few issues reported with the same error for various reasons.

In case of import process, we have identified this error to occur when we import more than 1000 issues. However, this also occurs even though we do not have 1000 issues.

On investigating further, we identified that it is due to the "+*misconfiguration in the configuration file uploaded*+". Removing the configuration file/remove the fields mapping fixed the issue.

This solution could not be related to the error message that we get on screen.
h3. Expected Results

Error messages should be more related to the actual problem. Ideally, in this scenario, it should have been erroring out when the configuration file was uploaded. There should be a scanning mechanism checking the authenticity of the file.
h3. Actual Results

The error observed as 

!image-2021-02-10-19-03-48-381.png|width=306,height=128!
fields.summary: Misleading error message during import process.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old view, it used to be possible to copy and paste an image using cmd(ctrl)+v into the issue. This no longer works.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy an image from a comment.
 # Try to paste the attachment in the description field.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to paste attachments in the old issue view.

h3. Actual Results
This feature no longer works.

h3. Workaround
*clip button > insert the thumbnail*
!image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cmd+V doesn't paste attachments into old issue view

fields.description:
Availability to trigger all formula cells once the scheduled or manual refresh of Jira Google sheet add-on is executed.

When the Google sheet is refreshed from the Jira add-in schedule function or manual, the formula cell immediately triggers looking to retrieve the data but since the data is still being retrieved it will show the error message that there is no data on it.
fields.summary: Availability to trigger all formula cells once the scheduled or manual refresh of Jira Google sheet add-on is executed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a site where a payment method is already required but not yet filled in, or where the credit card configured for the payment either exceeded the limit or expired, new app installation will fail without returning any error message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Initiate a new free trial for any paid app on any of the following setup:
 - Scenario 1 : On a sandbox site where an existing app free trial has already expired.
 - Scenario 2 : On a Jira free site where a Confluence standard free trial has already expired.
 - Scenario 3: On a Jira standard site for which the Credit Card configured as the payment method either exceeded the limit or expired (as documented in: [Unable to Install any Cloud Add-ons|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-install-any-cloud-add-ons-971608404.html])

!Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 2.02.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The app installation should either proceed or at least indicate that there are issues with the payment method and this is required in order to proceed with new free trials.
h3. Actual Results

The installation will go on a spinning wheel for a while and then stop without providing any information

On the managed apps audit log, the app will be indicated as installed. After 4 minutes, the app will automatically be uninstalled.

!Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 1.59.42 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Add a valid Credit Card. In case of further issues after doing so, or in case you need to have the payment processed asap so you can install the desired app, create a support request using the below link and selecting: "Billing, payments, and pricing" and then "Problems with a payment or credit card"
 - [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: App install fails silently in case of issues with the payment method

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence pages links in Jira issues are not synced if Jira issue macro is removed from the page *OR* if the page is deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few issues in Jira and a page in Confluence
 # Paste direct Jira issues URL in the page and publish
 #  Observe the section *Confluence pages mentioned on* in Jira issues
 # Edit the page and remove Jira issue macro *OR* delete the page entirely
 # Check again the *mentioned on* section

h3. Expected Results

With application link setup, the integration between Jira and Confluence should be synced. With issue macro removed or page deleted, the links to pages in issues get updated accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

Links to Confluence pages are left in Jira issue either as working link but as irrelevant link to pages *OR* broken link if the page is removed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence pages links in Jira issues are not synced

fields.description: It would be nice if when selecting the *Print* option from the Jira issue view, if the timestamps considered the timezone of the user who initiated the print. Currently, it displays in *UTC* which can not only show incorrect times, but also dates.
fields.summary: Consider a user's timezone when using the Print option while viewing an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the time section of a date time picker consists of a time between 12:00 AM to 12:59 AM or 12 PM to 12:59 PM, the time shows as 0:mm AM/PM. This could be replicated if profile language is set to most languages other than English(US).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set profile language to anything other than English (US) and any timezone.
 # Create a custom field of type date time picker.
 # Set a date and time between 12 AM 12:59 AM or 12 PM and 12:59 PM.

h3. Expected Results
 # 12 - 12:59 AM should show as 12:mm AM and 12 - 12:59 PM should show as 12:mm PM. 00:mm is a 24 hour format for times between 12 to 12:59 AM but there is no such thing as 0:mm AM/PM.

h3. Actual Results

The time format is 0:mm AM/PM.
 !bug.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * The issue is not reproducible on the old view because uses relative time instead
 * While editing the field the value is displayed as 12 AM/PM, but once we save the value it's displayed as 0 AM/PM.
 !edit view.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Set your profile language to English(US).
fields.summary: Date time picker shows 12 AM/PM as 0 AM/PM

fields.description:
h3. Summary

By now, it's not possible to copy Attachments through an Automation rule. This is not something doable through an Edit Issue fields, Clone Issue or Create Issue action as also there is no "Copy attachments" action available.

https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1030
h3. Expected Results

It would be nice to copy attachments between issues through an Automation rule when needed.
h3. Actual Results

Today, when creating/cloning an issue and copying fields from another issue, it's not possible to also copy the attachments, what implies manual work.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround available at this moment.
fields.summary: Possibility to copy attachments through Automation rule

fields.description:
As a user, I think that there should be a way to import
workflows to the Marketplace that's simplified as long as a) it's private,
b) can only be used with Atlassian sites you administer, c) that are also
not available to the public (as is the case with our Jira).

For example, I tried uploading workflows and could not use them when marked
as private. Then when I went through all the steps to make them public,
they were rejected because they were missing information that *was not
marked as mandatory*.
fields.summary: Support for private workflow migrations without uploading it to Atlassian Marketplace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing an Epic from a dashboard (the URL is mounted as https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id=xxx), the Epic issue type isn't listed on the dropdown of the issue type field. As a result, it is not possible to edit the issue, because if you save your changes, the issue type will be changed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard that list Epics.
 # Choose any Epic from a Next-gen project and click Edit
 # Once you are on the edit page, the 'IssueType' field shows another issues type and you can't select 'Epic' any longer, as it is not listed.

h3. Expected Results

Have the Epic issue type listed on the drop-down of the issue type field, as occurs on  Epics from Classic projects.
h3. Actual Results

The Epic issue type isn't listed on the drop-down and you can't edit the issue.
h3. Workaround

Edit the issue by clicking on the issue link at the top.
fields.summary: Editing an Epic of a Next-Gen project in a dashboard doesn't list the EPIC issue type on the issue type field.

fields.description:
The error messages for the "Number of Results" field in Two-dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget is misleading."Number of Results" field can take the input upto 50, any number greater than 50 results in the error "Provided value must be a number".

*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create a Dashboard and add Two-dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget 
 * Fill the required details.
 * When we key in *Number of Results* field with a number greater than 50.

h3. Actual result

An error/warning stating "Provided value must be a number" will be displayed.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected result

We must display a warning message something like "Number of Results field can display 50 results per page".

*Note:* The error message is misleading, request to add a message that would notify user about the maximum value that can be entered.
fields.summary: Two-dimensional filter statistics gadget - misleading error message for No. of Results

fields.description:
Hello,

when creating a ticket on Jira Service Desk, I would like to have a mandatory field with the existing UAT project Jira ID  and the only way I think is possibilite to do this is adding a Custom field. Unfortunately the select list only accepts static values added manually and would be very interesting to be able to load values from a filter.

Thanks.

 

Best regards,

Ricardo Silva
fields.summary: Custom fields | Dynamic Select List loaded from filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Default issue type is not displaying when creating an issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a default issue type in a project, say project *KANBAN01* (_pid=<project id>_) with default issue type _Bug_ (_issuetype=<issue type id>_)
 # Enter the following URL to create issue
{code:java}
 https://<instance>.atlassian.net/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=<project id>
 {code}

h3. Expected Results
 * The *Create Issue* screen is presented with the Project and Issue Type fields pre-populated

h3. Actual Results
 * The Project field is populated correctly; however, the Issue Type field is populated with a random issue type

h3. Workaround
 * Use the following URL to get the screen with the
{code:java}
 https://<instance>.atlassian.net/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=<project id>&issuetype=<issue type id>
 {code}
fields.summary: Default issue type is not displaying when creating an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the *Filter Counts* dashboard gadget, building a custom count incorrectly allows an invalid JQL query to be saved.

The same JQL query does not work on the Advanced Search feature

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Filter Counts dashboard gadget and build a custom count
 # On the criteria field, enter an invalid JQL query. E.g:
{noformat}project = SANDBOX AND "Custom A" = Test{noformat}
(i) 'Custom A' is a textbox so the '=' operator is unsupported

h3. Expected Results
The Build custom count on the 'Filter Counts' gadget should show the JQL query as invalid and not allow the count to be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The Build custom count on the 'Filter Counts' gadget shows the JQL query as valid and allows to be saved.

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-08 at 14.46.17.png|thumbnail! 

On the search page, the query is invalid:
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-08 at 14.46.47.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Make sure to run a JQL query through the Jira search page first before saving the query in the gadget.
fields.summary: Filter counts Dashboard Gadget allows invalid JQL query for custom count

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Next Unreleased version" doesn't work for edit issue field "Fix versions" in Automation for Jira. "Last released version" doesn't work as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set some unreleased versions in Project setting
 # Create a new Automation rule in Automation for Jira
 ** Set the appropriate trigger.
 ** Set "Next unreleased version" (or "Last released version") for edit issue field "Fix versions"

h3. Expected Results

After triggering, the appropriate version is set in the field "Fix versions".
h3. Actual Results

After triggering, nothing is set in the field "Fix versions".
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Next Unreleased version" doesn't work for edit issue field "Fix versions" in Automation for Jira.

fields.description:
When using the Mac app for Jira Cloud, you cannot currently view the dashboards. However this is still something that can be configured in the web interface.

Please consider implementing this as it would allow a consistent UX across web and mac app interface.
fields.summary: Allow viewing dashboards via macOS app

fields.description:
- When using the advanced issue search and exporting to a Google Sheet, the user (Basic) will get redirected to a screen to authorize the app (Example: Jira for Spreadsheets)

- After that, the connection is shown on the Connected Apps section on admin.atlassian.com
- The site-admin has control and can revoke those connections by navigating to https://admin.atlassian.com/s/CLOUDID/user-connected-apps 

- But the fact is a basic user has the ability to integrate apps without ORG or site-admin member approval

However, all those apps are from Atlassian and the customer is not being billed by them.
fields.summary: Requesting for a feature so that the site-admin has the control which user could integrate "connect apps" for example, Jira Cloud for Spreadsheets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to see the options when clicking on the Lock comments' button using the dialog pop-up screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board that has the security level option for comments.
# Click on any issue and wait for the dialog screen to pop-up
# Go to the comments section and try to set a restriction level on your new comment

h3. Expected Results

The lock button should display the available options.

h3. Actual Results

The options appear in the background for that issue. Check the video below to see the behavior:

* https://share.getcloudapp.com/9Zu8AKBE

 !Screen+Recording+2021-02-05+at+04.53.52+PM.gif! 

h3. Workaround

Open the issue on a new browser tab.
fields.summary: Lock comments' button is broken on dialog pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Summary

By now, to delete an archived project, the user needs to first restore the project, then move it to trash and only after that completely remove this.
h3. Expected Results

It would be nice to have the possibility to delete the project directly from the Archived projects section, as currently possible on [Data Center hosting|https://share.getcloudapp.com/mXu1q1W1]:

  !image-2021-02-05-13-46-16-883.png|width=585,height=169!
h3. Actual results

To delete an archived project, it's needed to first restore this and then move it to trash.
h3. Workaround

If you need to delete an archived project, first restore the project and only after this move this to trash through _Project Settings > Details_, as shown here: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/RBu40r4P]
fields.summary: Ability to directly delete archived projects on Cloud

fields.description:
*Improvement* - 
 The size of the grid should change in a way such that it accommodates an issue to any status when there are multiple statuses in a single column

*How to replicate?* -
 * Create a Kanban board such that it has a column with multiple statuses mapped to it. (Let's say ToDo, InProgress (with status Development and QA), Done)
 * Create a new issue (There should be no issue created on this board previously). This will show up in the ToDo column.
 * Drag the issue to drop it to the ToDo column. You will see that the column will split into two sections (Development and QA) but the grey box present is small which would prevent us from dropping the issue to the status present at the bottom. You can only drop it to the top of the column.

This will not happen when you have multiple issues on the board since the grey area in the column gets changed as per column with maximum issues.

*Workaround* -

For the first issue, kindly change it manually from within the ticket.
fields.summary: Size of the column should change in a way such that it allows you to drop an issue to any status, when there are multiple status in a single column

fields.description: As a site/org admin, it is useful to have a users report. What it would be more beneficial though would be to be able to get all the information indicated in their Atlassian account profile, like the job title, department, organization, based in, and local time.
fields.summary: As a site/org admin I would like to be able to generate reports with all the details from users accounts

fields.description:
In the Old Issue View, plugins like [harvest Time Tracker|https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjog9zbw9LuAhWr7XMBHe77CPIQFjAAegQIAhAC&url=https%3A%2F%2Fmarketplace.atlassian.com%2Fapps%2F1211628%2Fharvest-time-tracking-official&usg=AOvVaw1_Ofopdi6-ZIoGiGWdNQNW] can appear directly on the view issue screen but in New Issue View, the user has to click multiple times to get the same results. Please check the attached screenshots.

New issue View: You click on the field first and then you would have to click on the next screens couple of times 
!image-2021-02-08-12-21-05-693.png|width=89,height=68!

Old issue view: everything on the view issue screen
 !image-2021-02-05-21-16-49-262.png|width=125,height=73!

Can we have the same behavior in the New issue view?

 

Thank you
