fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to create new sprints If a board has 2 projects in the filter and one of those is archived even if they are using the same permission scheme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a board put 2 projects in the filter using the same permission scheme
 # Grant the manage sprint permission to a basic user
 # Archive one of the projects
 # In the board with the two projects try to create a new sprint

h3. Expected Results
The sprint should be able to be created as the user has the manage sprint permission in both projects (they are using the same scheme)

h3. Actual Results

The user is not able to create sprints showing the message that the manage sprint permission is needed

h3. Workaround
Remove the archived project from the filter
Or, Restore the original project
fields.summary: Not able to create new sprints If a board has 2 projects in the filter and one is archived

fields.description: Currently, all users who have the same domain as the founding user can discover and see the team, and join themselves. The ability to change the visibility of a team will prevent unintended additions of members and other inconveniences.
fields.summary: The ability to set the visibility of a team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue *Comments* are not included in the payload received when an automation rule with *Send web request* action (and Webhook body = Issue Data) is executed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Set up an automation rule with any trigger
 * Use the *Send web request* action
 ** You'll need a webhook URL
 ** Choose HTTP method: POST
 ** Set Webhook body = Issue Data
 ** Save and execute
 ** Go to Webhook URL

h3. Expected Results
JSON payload containing a section with issue comments in it.

h3. Actual Results
Payload no longer contains a section for comments.

h3. Workaround
Use *Custom Data* as Webhook body instead, and fetch data with Smart values
fields.summary: Send web request action is no longer sending comments in webhooks issue payload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For environments that create a second global rank custom field (for example called 'Rank2'), it appears that there is a ranking check on the board that is incorrectly triggering a warning that in turn will prevent users from using that new rank field for drag and drop ranking on a board that is ordered by that rank field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Global Rank Custom field (example name of Rank2)
 # Create a saved JQL filter for an existing JSW classic scrum project such that it tries to use this new field (example JQL of
{code:java}
project=SCRUM order by rank2 ASC
{code}
Note that this example refers to 'rank2' by lower case.)

 # Create a new board of type scrum, choose from saved JQL filter, pick filter saved previous
 # In the backlog of this new board, attempt to drag and drop the order of any issue in order to change it's rank2 value

h3. Expected Results

Expect that rank2 value for that issue will be changed according to its relative position to other issues on the board
h3. Actual Results
 * Ranking does not happen to the 'rank2' field.
 * Instead the end users sees this error message
{quote}Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by ascending Rank. Please check your filter configuration.
{quote}
 * The filter the board is using should not be case sensitive for any JQL term being referred to here.
 *   !ranking is disabled.png|thumbnail!
 * !board config.png|thumbnail!
 * !customfieldsrank.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Changing the JQL saved filter from:
{code:java}
project=SCRUM order by rank2 ASC 
{code}
into:
{code:java}
project=SCRUM order by Rank2 ASC 
{code}
Then save that filter, and reload the board.  This will then allow you to rank issues using this new custom field rank value instead of the default rank value.
fields.summary: using a second rank field on a board filter is incorrectly case sensitive, causing ranking to be disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When uploading a large xlsx file (almost 2MB) the new issue view UI displays an error 'Failed to load'. The issue does not occur when using old issue view, nor with REST API - only with new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue, and click on the "Attach" button.
 # Once the upload screen is open, click on the "upload a file" button
 # Select xlsx file and upload the file - you will see the error "Failed to load"

!upload_fail_xlsx.png!
h3. Expected Results

File should be uploaded in the "Recent Uploads" screen using new issue view and not throw any error.
h3. Actual Results

Error is thrown in new issue view.
h3. Workaround

Files can be uploaded using the old issue view, or using the REST API.
fields.summary: Uploading a large xlsx file in new issue view throws error 'Failed to load'

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to build a dynamic validation the assignable user permission based on group values.

This works only when selecting assignee through the issue view. 
Once there is a transition with a screen containing the assignee field, the validation considers the current status of the issue, not the destination status, which violates the whole idea of the validation proposed.
fields.summary: Ability to validate assignable user permission during workflow transition

fields.description: Availability to add custom buttons on Transition screens
fields.summary: Availability to add custom buttons on Transition screens

fields.description:
After a new release, Jira is displaying a Discover on Apps button that shows some apps that can be used on our Jira. 

I'd like to be able to hide this option from my Jira as it can be confusing and disruptive for other regular users. 

 !Screen Shot 2021-01-12 at 5.17.31 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator, I'd like to be able to hide the "Discover" option on Apps drop-down button

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When changing the highlight color using the Look and Feel option, as per the message displayed on Jira, it should change the create button color and the *highlighted navigation items*. Here only the create button color is changed, while the highlight button is a default greycolor.

As per the message displayed on Jira , it should change the highlighted navigation item color as well.
Message on Jira Software
*Highlight*
*The color of the create button and highlight color for the selected navigation item*


h3. Environment
Jira Software
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Settings> system>User Interface > look and feel
Under navigation > change the color of the highlight 
You will see that the highlight is applied only to create button and not to the  selected navigation item


h3. Expected Results
Highlight color is applied  to create button and to the selected navigation item
h3. Actual Results
highlight is applied only to create button and not to the selected navigation item
h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
This is a confusing message for customers and does not do what is intended.
fields.summary: Highlight does not change the color of the selected navigation item

fields.description:
As a user

I would like the ability to create a bug/task from the comment of an existing Task and automatically link it.
fields.summary: Create a new task/bug from a comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performance issue when viewing Jira issue via popup in Safari browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari 14.0.3 or later.
# Go to a board and click on an issue.

h3. Expected Results
Popup loads within a reasonable time.

h3. Actual Results
The popup will be shown after some time.

h3. Workaround

Use a different browser while this is being fixed.

*OR*

Workaround for Safari:
# Open an issue in your Jira Board
# At the top right of the issue you’ll see a meatball button that opens a dropdown next to the X.
# At or near the bottom of the dropdown menu you’ll find an option titled “Open issues in sidebar”, click this.
# Your issues should now load the same way they do in the Jira Backlog, on the right side of the page.
fields.summary: Degraded performance in Jira using Safari browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An app developer has observed that that the worklogs retrieved via the REST API do not always have author and update_author fields. This can lead to failed processing if there is an assumption that these are mandatory fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fetch worklogs using the REST API.
 # Scan the worklogs to check the author and update_author fields are always present.

h3. Expected Results

The author and update_author fields are always present..
h3. Actual Results

The author and update_author fields are not always present.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Imported worklogs are missing the`author` and `update_author` fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Quickstart menu can appear over the top of app contributed project pages, obscuring content from the app iframe when it shouldn't.

!devhelp-5695-qickstart.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that contributes a project page such as Zephyr Scale ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?query=Zephyr%20Scale)] in a new instance.
 # Navigate to the app's project page (e.g. Zephyr Scale main section).

h3. Expected Results

Nothing would be hiding app's project page content - the page module should be clear of any Jira information given it is reserved for the app.
h3. Actual Results

There is a new onboarding placeholder "Quickstart" hiding the app content.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Jira's onboarding menu "quickstart" is hiding the app content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we try to update the favicon two times, the second upload won't be updated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access "*<Jira_instance>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa*".
 # Upload a favicon.
 # Then, try to upload a different favicon.
 # Restore to default the favicon.
 # Next, try to upload a different favicon.
 # [This video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/GGu60vkE] shows the steps.

h3. Expected Results

This favicon should be updated.
h3. Actual Results

The favicon won't be updated.
h3. Workaround

No workaround found yet.
fields.summary: Favicon won't be updated after the first upload

fields.description:
*Issue* - While creating an issue in Jira Cloud for Mac app vs the Jira site, the order of fields will show up as very different. The app will show the fields in alphabetical order while in the web version, it will show up as per set in issue layout. Perhaps the layouts do not work well with the Mac app.

*Steps* -
 * Set up a project and add a create screen with some fields such as Mobile, City, Address, etc. and the layout can have these in any random order.
 * Click on create button on the site to see Create issue screen which will show the fields as per the layout set.
 * Go to Jira Cloud for the Mac app and try creating the issue. You will notice that the fields are showing up in alphabetical order and the layout is not working.

 

The issue is replicable at our end and would request you to kindly fix the same.
fields.summary: Layout difference between Create screen in Jira cloud for Mac app vs the site
